Taganrog military museum
Таганрогский военно-исторический музей
Established May 9, 2004 (opened on May 6, 2010)
Location Taganrog, Russia
Coordinates 47°13′22.44″N 38°56′3.22″E﻿ / ﻿47.2229000°N 38.9342278°E﻿ / 47.2229000; 38.9342278
Director ru:Гаркуша Игорь Викторович
Website military-museum.ru

Taganrog military museum is the first private museum in Taganrog.

Contents

  • 1 Museum history
  • 2 Museum exhibits
    • 2.1 Cars and motorcycles
    • 2.2 Weapon full-scale mockups
    • 2.3 Other exhibits
    • 2.4 Gallery
  • 3 Location and opening hours[1]
  • 4 References
  • 5 External links

Museum history[edit]

The start of museum exhibition creation refers to May 9, 2004, when the club Auto-Retro Taganrog was founded. Subsequently, several vehicle units were purchased and repaired. In 2008, club activity concept got military direction. On May 6, 2010, permanent exhibition consisting of several thousands of exhibits was opened. In July 2012, the name Taganrog military museum got official status.

In the night of October 25. 2014 the building of the Taganrog Military Museum and all of its exhibits were completely destroyed by fire.

Under the museum was formed military historical club participating in historical reenactments in Rostov-on-Don, Voronezh, Volgograd, Novocherkassk, Kiev, Odessa, Brest, Berlin and other cities.

Museum exhibits[edit]

Cars and motorcycles[edit]

  • GAZ-AA truck (in Russian)
  • GAZ-67 jeep
  • BA-64 armoured car
  • Opel P4 car (in Russian)
  • Opel Olympia car
  • TIZ-AM-600 motorcycle (in Russian)
  • М-72 motorcycle
  • BMW R12 motorcycle
  • Victoria Aero motorcycle
  • NSU 251OSL motorcycle

Weapon full-scale mockups[edit]

  • Shpagin machine pistol (PPSh-41)
  • Sudaev's submachine-gun (PPS)
  • Tokarev Self-loading Rifle (SVT-40)
  • Thompson submachine gun
  • Mosin–Nagant
  • Nagant M1895 Revolver
  • Tokarev self-loading pistol
  • Makarov pistol
  • Volkov-Yartsev VYa-23 aircraft autocannon
  • Degtyaryov's machine gun (DP, DT)
  • PTRD anti-tank rifle
  • PTRS-41 anti-tank rifle
  • Maschinengewehr 34 (MG 34) machine gun
  • MP 40 submachine gun
  • Karabiner 98 Kurz bolt-action rifle
  • Mauser C96 semi-automatic pistol
  • Walther P38 semi-automatic pistol
  • Luger P08 pistol (Parabellum)

Other exhibits[edit]

Ammunition mockups, cold weapons, military uniform, documents, household goods and other relics.

Gallery[edit]

Location and opening hours[1][edit]

  • Location: Russian Federation, Taganrog, st. Lesnaya Birzha, 20 b
  • Telephone: +7 (8634) 322-222, 321-222, 323-222, 31-90-60, 322-700, 322-666
  • Opening hours:
    summer: 9:00 until 17:00
    winter, spring, autumn: Mon-Fri 9:00 until 17:00, Sat 9:00 until 15:00, day off - Sun
